item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://www.haritgriha.org.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
Sustainable Living

HARIT GRIHA

An initiative to reconnect human beings with nature. Organisation focuses on making infrastructures sustainable and building a n-compassionate world.

Know MOre

Big change happens through many small changes that we make in our daily lives

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J4h7nWxGZtI

Green warriors take on composting

One-year Journey

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YWiJSQHrxQwhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WH941CErUqM

Customer Feedback

Testimonials

Testimonial 1

Composting is my first step towards mother earth and its been great and fruitful journey all along

Testimonial 2

We were doing some composting before getting these Harit Griha composters. But, now the whole setup has really helped the composting process, specially the feedback from team

Testimonial 3

It makes me feel great-full, as not sending out waste every day and instead composting it, using it in my garden, is such a rewarding process. Harit Griha team has been a great supporter

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
About Us

The connection between the humans and nature is important for us to live together. And this is somewhere lost in the recent history of time. The need of the hour is to understand the importance of co-existing with nature to maintain the balance of the earth, as we will not be able to outlive nature.

Ecology has been integral part of our culture, where rituals involve sense of connection to nature. Our forefathers, knew the importance of nature, and that is why most of our festivals had knots tied to nature in many aspects.

Harit Griha aims at providing simplified solutions to the community on sustainable infrastructure and reconnecting humans to nature by:

  • Providing services to the people through environmental expertise and turn key solutions
  • Creating awareness through Focused group discussions and Eco-living events
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HKpH89xAAWs

What's circular economy?

Vision

To enable sustainable living through simple solutions

Mission

  • Reconnecting humans with nature
  • Provide simple solutions to make sustainable infrastructures

Values

Respect

Respecting every living and non-living beings, believing in the circular cycle of what you give, you get back

Care

Care for nature, as we care for our loved ones

Freedom

Freedom of thoughts, work, deed and working towards our vision

Awareness Attitude Intention Action

item.title: Team
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
Our team

Swati

Founder and Early Bird

Swati is passionate about working with communities in the field of environment and co-creating solutions for environment management.

She has worked with Centre for Science and Environment, New Delhi (CSE) and Janaagraha, Bangalore. Has completed her post-graduation in "Development Leadership" from Indian School of Development Management (ISDM) and Bachelors from St. Joseph College, Bangalore.

She loves dancing, singing at the top of her voice, reading books and cooking at times. She also crazily enjoys playing basketball, football and being single in life forever ;)

Facebook Twitter Dribbble Behance

Jagadish

VP of Misc. Stuff

Jagdish is a horticulturalist with expertise in urban gardening. He enjoys gardening and making its information simple and accessible to all. He has worked for more than 10 years and have grown a wide variety of vegetables, fruits, flowers and herbal plants.

He delights in exploring various traditional as well as advanced gardening techniques and executing the knowledge in work. He inspires people for home gardening so as to eat healthy, chemical free vegetables and fruits.

He provides consulting services to localities, helping them to improve their productivity. Being an environment lover and responsible human he believes in reducing and reusing waste materials and hence combines his urban gardening with the concept of reusage and uses plastic bottles, empty boxes, tyres & buckets for growing plants.

Facebook Twitter Dribbble Behance

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Team
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
Our team

Swati

Founder and Chief Learning Officer (CLO)

Born in Assam, brought up in seven different states of India and hailing from Uttar Pradesh, Swati has lived in varied cultures of this country. Oneness being the value she believes in, she is passionate about working with communities in the field of environment and co-creating solutions for environment management.

She has worked with Centre for Science and Environment, New Delhi (CSE) and Janaagraha, Bangalore. Has completed her post-graduation in "Development Leadership" from Indian School of Development Management (ISDM) and Bachelors in Environmental Sciences from St. Joseph College, Bangalore.

Keep Living, Learning, Acting and Reflecting is what she believes in.

Ankit Das

shaktimaan

Ankit calls himself a 'banjaraa' (social nomad) and has an overall experience of working since mid-2010, which include working as a writer, running his own business in the IT/ITES, and a development sector experience of working in rural parts of Uttarakhand, Maharashtra and rural Assam. He initiated the banjaraa network and is a Founder Trustee of Jeevan Shiksha in Assam.

His sensitivity towards basic challenges faced by people, and his inability to ignore the societal indifference in general, led to him exploring villages during his graduation. This eventually evolved into working with Goonj, followed by others. He has worked in domains like disaster management, strategy and planning, menstrual hygiene and sanitation, with tribal populations in militancy-affected areas on various issues.

Ankit has experience in using Movie therapy as a tool, a hobby photographer and helps small NGOs with portfolio building. He has walked in Gujarat (400 kms) without money and tech, in Bastar (200 kms) while cycled without money in Assam with few others (1700 kms). He also walked along with four others from Dehradun to Yamunotri Pilgrimage (190 kms) without money. He recently walked from Pondicherry to Dharwad (1200 kms) on foot, without money and phone.

"He strongly stands for Love and Compassion through Ahimsa for all."

Jagdish

VP of Miscellaneous Stuff

He is a nature lover and enjoys gardening and making its information simple and accessible to all. He has been with plants for more than 10 years and have grown a wide variety of vegetables, fruits, flowers and herbal plants.

He delights in exploring various traditional as well as advanced gardening techniques and executing the knowledge in work. He inspires people for home gardening so as to eat healthy, chemical free vegetables and fruits.

Being an environment lover and responsible human he believes in reducing and reusing waste materials and hence combines his urban gardening with the concept of reuse and uses plastic bottles, empty boxes, tyres & buckets for growing plants.

item.title: Udyam Home Composter
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
Home Composting Kit that eases the composting process at home. The kit includes-
  • Composter
  • Rake to stir the compost regularly
  • Mixing powder provides carbon to compost and reduces moisture
  • Microbes decomposes wet waste
  • A User guide that explains composting process and tell Dos and Donts
item.excerpt:encoded: Home Composting Kit that eases the composting process at home.

item.title: Mixing Powder
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded: Mixing Powder provides carbon and reduces moisture of the biodegradable waste. Also has some microbes mixed in it.
item.excerpt:encoded: Mixing Powder provides carbon and reduces moisture of the biodegradable waste. Also has some microbes mixed in it.

item.title: Rake
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded: Used to stir the waste, which is an important task in aerobic composting. Also, reduces the time duration in making of compost.
item.excerpt:encoded: Used to stir the waste, which is an important task in aerobic composting. Also, reduces the time duration in making of compost.

item.title: What we do
item.dc:creator: haritgriha
item.content:encoded:
What We do?

Consultancy Services


At Harit Griha, we believe, that we humans are capable of doing anything. Therefore, through our consultancy services we try to foster those capabilities of humans by acting as a catalyst. Enabling community to perform better and act in right direction.
Under our Program Paramarsh, we provide consultancy in the following areas:

- Composting
- Creating Zero-Waste Zones
- Waste Management for Colonies, Offices, Schools, Colleges
- Rooftop Gardening
- Rainwater Harvesting

Workshops & Eco-living Events


To act on the key issue of climate change, we first need to understand what is the problem and what are the options available in order to make the right lifestyle choice. Through Program Aagaaz, we do awareness talks and workshops in the community about present pressing issues of climate change. We also organize Eco-Living Events, where community is introduced to several eco-living products. Both workshops and events provides experiential learning to the community.

Initiating Dialogues In And Among Schools


Schools are nurturing the future of this world and it is very important to take their perspective on environment as our future generations will be taking over the world in much worse condition than it is today. Schools are one of those institutions who have the capacity to advocate for changes in their respective areas.

In schools and colleges, we organise awareness talks and workshops that provides experiential learning to students. We also provide short-term courses/certificate courses to school and college students where we introduce all the earth elements to the students and how can students become a better citizen in future.

Gallery

  • Agaaz - Workshop and Eco-Living Events
  • Paramarsh - Consultancy Services
  • Tarang - Initiating dialogues in and among Schools
  • Media Coverage
